revised_title: Explaining Anomalous Electron Absorption Effects in Metal Foils
tldr: The authors apply the two-beam dynamical theory of electron diffraction to explain features of bend and thickness extinction contours and images of stacking faults observed in transmission electron micrographs of metal foils. They describe anomalous transmission effects due to inelastic scattering processes and introduce a complex lattice potential to account for absorption. The theory allows for the estimation of absorption parameters, but further investigation is needed to understand the mechanisms of inelastic electron scattering.
